title: SmarterMail Auth Bypass to RCE Chain: 6,000+ Servers Exposed to Automated Hijacking (CISA KEV)
affected_products: SmarterTools SmarterMail versions prior to Build 9511

timeline.event: SmarterTools releases Build 9413 patching CVE-2025-52691 (pre-auth file upload)
SmarterTools releases Build 9511 patching CVE-2026-23760 (auth bypass)
WatchTowr Labs publishes technical analysis; PoC appears on GitHub within 48 hours
Active exploitation begins - attackers reverse-engineer patch within 2 days
Over 6,000 internet-exposed SmarterMail servers identified as vulnerable
CISA adds CVE-2026-23760 and CVE-2025-52691 to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog

simple_summary.what_happened: Two critical vulnerabilities in SmarterTools SmarterMail email server create a devastating attack chain. CVE-2026-23760 (CVSS 9.3) allows unauthenticated attackers to reset the system administrator password through a flawed password reset API. CVE-2025-52691 (CVSS 10.0) enables pre-authentication arbitrary file upload leading to remote code execution. Attackers reverse-engineered the January 15 patch within just 2 days and began mass exploitation. Over 6,000 internet-exposed SmarterMail servers remain vulnerable.
simple_summary.who_is_affected: Organizations using SmarterTools SmarterMail for email hosting and collaboration. SmarterMail is popular among SMBs, web hosting providers, and enterprises seeking self-hosted email solutions. Any organization running SmarterMail versions prior to Build 9511 with internet-exposed management interfaces is at critical risk. The 6,000+ exposed servers represent a significant attack surface.
simple_summary.what_attackers_do: Step 1: Identify internet-exposed SmarterMail servers through scanning. Step 2: Send unauthenticated HTTP POST to /api/v1/auth/force-reset-password with IsSysAdmin=true. Step 3: Reset system administrator password without knowing current credentials. Step 4: Login as system administrator with the new password. Step 5: Navigate to Settings and abuse the legitimate 'Volume Mount Command' feature to execute OS commands. Step 6: Achieve SYSTEM-level remote code execution on the underlying Windows server. Alternatively, exploit CVE-2025-52691 to directly upload webshells for RCE without the auth bypass chain.
what_you_should_do: Immediately upgrade to SmarterMail Build 9511 or later
Block external access to SmarterMail management interfaces
Implement WAF rules to block requests to /api/v1/auth/force-reset-password
Audit administrator accounts for unauthorized password changes
Check for webshells or unauthorized files in web directories
Enable multi-factor authentication for all administrator accounts
Review Volume Mount Command settings for malicious entries
Monitor for unusual process execution on SmarterMail servers
simple_summary.why_this_is_serious: Email servers are high-value targets containing sensitive communications, credentials, and business data. The vulnerability chain enables complete server takeover with SYSTEM privileges from a single unauthenticated HTTP request. Attackers weaponized this within 48 hours of patch release, demonstrating sophisticated reverse engineering capabilities. With 6,000+ exposed servers and public PoC code available, mass exploitation is ongoing. Compromised email servers can be used for business email compromise (BEC), data theft, spam campaigns, and as pivot points into internal networks.

tactics.description: Exploiting the password reset API without authentication
Resetting administrator password through vulnerable API
Executing commands via Volume Mount Command feature
Uploading webshells through arbitrary file upload vulnerability
Gaining SYSTEM privileges through RCE vulnerabilities
Accessing stored emails on compromised mail server

detection_guidance.summary: Monitor for unauthorized requests to the password reset API endpoint, unusual administrator logins, webshell indicators, and suspicious process execution from the SmarterMail application context.

log_sources.description: API access logs, authentication events, admin actions
HTTP requests to vulnerable API endpoints
Process creation and privilege escalation events

what_to_look_for.description: POST requests to /api/v1/auth/force-reset-password without valid session
POST requests to /api/upload with suspicious file extensions
New .aspx files appearing in web directories
what_to_look_for.log_field: File creation in SmarterMail web directories

what_to_look_for.description: Changes to Volume Mount Command settings in SmarterMail
cmd.exe, powershell.exe spawned by SmarterMail processes

immediate_actions.description: Immediately upgrade to Build 9511 or later
Block external access to SmarterMail administrative interfaces
Scan web directories for unauthorized .aspx, .ashx files
Review administrator accounts and recent password changes
Check Settings for malicious commands in Volume Mount Command field
